    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>

            <entry>cahi1:data_86902</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="fr">Décomposition des roches</string>
            <string language="en">Breaking down rocks</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Brechen hinunter Felsen</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Quebrar abaixo rochas</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Suddivisione delle roccie</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Χωρισμός των βράχων</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Subdivisión de rocas</string>
          </title>
          <language>x-none</language>
          <description>
            <string language="fr">Ce diagramme illustre comment des roches sont  décomposées en de plus petits morceaux qui se transforment en sable et en boue et sont transportées dans les sols et les rivières.</string>
            <string language="en">This diagram illustrates how rocks are broken down into smaller pieces becoming sand and mud which are transported in soils and rivers.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="fr">refroidissement</string>
            <string language="en">cooling</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="fr">réchauffement</string>
            <string language="en">Heating</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="fr">glace</string>
            <string language="en">ice</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="fr">boue</string>
            <string language="en">mud</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="fr">pluie</string>
            <string language="en">rain</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="fr">fleuves</string>
            <string language="en">Rivers</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="fr">roches</string>
            <string language="en">rocks</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="fr">sable</string>
            <string language="en">sand</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="fr">sols</string>
            <string language="en">soils</string>
          </keyword>
          <structure>
            <source>structureValues</source>
            <value>atomic</value>
          </structure>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Dieses Diagramm veranschaulicht, wie Felsen 
unterbrochener Abstieg in werdenen Sand der kleineren Stücke und 
Schlamm sind, die in Boden und in Flüsse transportiert werden.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Este diagrama ilustra como as rochas são pena 
quebrada na areia se tornando das partes menores e lama que são 
transportadas nos solos e nos rios.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Questo schema illustra come le roccie sono 
analizzate nella sabbia diventante e nel fango delle più piccole 
parti che sono trasportate in terreni ed in fiumi.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Αυτό το διάγραμμα επεξηγεί πώς οι βράχοι χωρίζονται 
σε μικρότερα κομμάτια που γίνονται άμμος και λάσπη που 
μεταφέρονται στα χώματα και τους ποταμούς.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Este diagrama ilustra cómo las rocas se analizan
en la arena que se convierte y el fango de pedazos más pequeños que 
se transportan en suelos y los ríos.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
